Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from eight fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed save for broad reserved band near lip; decoration in added red and white, from top: white zig-zag; red band between white bands; alternate red and white dot rosettes; red band lined in white; alternate red, white and black tongues with incised outline; red band lined in white; incised lotus and bud frieze. Exterior, cream slip: at lip, between bands, frieze of tongues with dots in interstices; below, zig-zag band dotted likewise; handle zone frieze preserves spotted panther to left facing a boar, tricked out with much red and incision; below, maeander band between bands with added red bands lined in white; below, frieze of goats grazing to left.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Belongs to same vase as 1888,06012.532a-c and e-h, and Oxford Ashmolean Museum G119.39.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 42, 48, pl. VIII, no. 1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.412)
